Package data

Class DatabaseModifier

java.lang.Object
data.DatabaseModifier
public class DatabaseModifier extends Object
Creates and interacts with Firebase; handles actions used to submit, fetch, and access essays, submissions, and other parts Allows the user to be able to add and set values inside the Database. Values of the Database can be accessed through a HashMap that includes the classrooms. The HashMap should not be used to modify the Database. Access the key and then push the values of the classroom through the add() and set() methods
Author:
Alex Wang, Kaz Nakao John Shelby for assistance in Firebase logic

  • Method Details

    • setupDatabase

      public static void setupDatabase()
      Creates a Database Reference and sets up necessary Firebase options

    • submitClassroomToDatabase

      public String submitClassroomToDatabase​(Classroom classroomSubmission)
      Submit classroom to Database
      Parameters:
      classroomSubmission - Classroom object to be submitted to database root
      Returns:
      postID from new data path (DatabaseReference) used to retrieve data

    • addStudentToClassroom

      public void addStudentToClassroom​(Student student, String classroomID)
      Submit Student object to known Classroom in Database
      Parameters:
      student - Student object to be added
      classroomID - postID of the classroom (returned by submitClassroomToDatabase())

    • set

      public static void set​(String key, Classroom classroom)
      Updates the classroom at a particular location in the database to a new Classroom object that is passed in through the parameter.
      Parameters:
      key - The location of the classroom in the database. This key should be obtained from the call to getClassrooms().
      classroom - The new classroom object that you want to update at the specified location.

    • addClassroom

      public static void addClassroom​(Classroom classroom)
      Adds a new classroom to the database. If you are trying to update existing data, use the set() method instead. This method will cause the database to create a new entry in the database instead of updating the classroom if it already exists.
      Parameters:
      classroom - The new Classroom object that you want to put into the database.

    • getClassrooms

      public static HashMap<String,​Classroom> getClassrooms()
      Returns a HashMap with key String and value Classroom to model the Database. This HashMap should not be modified. To modify the database, the add() and set() method equivalents should be used.
      Returns:
      A HashMap that contains the keys of the locations of the classrooms as a key and classroom objects that are at each of those locations in the database

    • getKey

      public static String getKey​(Classroom classroom)
      If the classroom does not exist in the database, an empty String will be returned
      Parameters:
      classroom - Classroom that you want to get the key of
      Returns:
      The key or location of the classroom in the database

    • getQueue

      public static ConcurrentLinkedQueue<Map.Entry<String,​Classroom>> getQueue()
